conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: walls extruded with thickness, multi-face surfaces visible, elevated angled view, and ceiling/roof removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable interior volume; good cutaway presentation. Minor simplification of some wall edges/corners and slight perspective/scale stylization.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall macro-zoning matches (living/dining with large window, kitchen near center-top, two bedrooms bottom corners, bath near center-bottom), but there are notable deviations: a stair/step feature appears on the left side that is not present in the 2D plan, and several interior partitions/door placements do not align perfectly with the plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (beds, sofa, dining table), kitchen appliances/cabinets present, and bathroom fixtures present. Some items are simplified and not always positioned exactly as implied by the 2D drawing.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with distinguishable walls/floors/openings and good lighting. No obvious broken meshes; background is clean and non-distracting.

detected_errors.description: A stair/step structure is introduced on the left side of the 3D model that does not correspond to the 2D plan, indicating a significant layout distortion.
Multiple door/opening placements and/or swing orientations appear inconsistent with the 2D plan (several interior door locations do not line up precisely).

summary: This is a valid and clear 3D cutaway conversion with strong fundamentals, but it contains notable layout deviations (especially an added stair/step feature) and some door/opening mismatches versus the 2D plan.
